siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Release expectations enjoy reality
frontmatter.description: There's no sense in holding on to a reality that doesn't exist. Move on. Find joy in the present reality.

frontmatter.title: Write the story, don't let it happen
frontmatter.description: The story doesn't have to be perfect. Don't sit back and let it happen. Write the story.

frontmatter.title: Take time for joy to inject new energy
frontmatter.description: Finding joy takes work sometimes. That's not a reason not to do it. Use joy + relaxation to inject energy into projects.

frontmatter.title: Make joy in present surroundings
frontmatter.description: There's no sense focusing on what is not possible. Accept the situation and make most of new opportunities.

frontmatter.title: Let nature relax and expand space in mind
frontmatter.description: There's never really getting away. We are always with ourselves. Use changes of perspective, surroundings and state wisely.

frontmatter.title: find joy in the present, there are no perfect conditions
frontmatter.description: There's so much out of our control and no sense hinging joy on uncontrollable. There's something good in everything. Work to find the joy in the present.

frontmatter.title: Approach activities with excitement
frontmatter.description: Excitement and joy shouldn't be put on hold due to outside, uncontrollable factors. Experience greatly depends on expecations, attitudes, and approaches.

frontmatter.title: Something good comes from all experiences
frontmatter.description: Something good comes from all experiences. Not looking for *everything* to be good because that's not true or realistic.

frontmatter.title: Trust in the future to find joy in the present
frontmatter.description: Trust in the future to find joy in the present. The future is steadily, continually approaching regardless of our actions.
